Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

       Hell Beast and Black Aracnia made there way through the jutting metal 
and scrap that was known as the Heap. The Heap had been a dumping ground used 
by the protohumans for a long while, and the Predacons dumped there 
biodigradable trash there as well. If Hell Beast was correct, then it would 
have remained undisturbed since the prothumans of the area had long been 
killed or fled.
       Aracnia was the first to reach the center of the mass. She couldnt 
recall why there were such large chunks of metal debris laying about. It 
appeared as if a ship had been totally obliterated by something. If it was 
Maximal, Predacon, or anything else would remain forever a mystery. All that 
reamined now was a shattered mass of steel and melted iron.
       "Do you think were going to find it, Hell Beast?" She adressed the 
senator. She no longer refered to him as commander, or treated him with such 
respect. As far as Aracnia was concerned he was just another foot soldier for 
the Predacon cause.
       He didnt respond. His face was buried in a small computer held in his 
hand. The green light emmited from it danced across his upper body as the 
moon drenched the Heap in a soft pale light. 
       Hell Beast quickly scanned over the data. The device he held was a 
basic scanning device that was out dated by the Beast Wars standards, but it 
was completely usable for this task. A round chart displayed all the 
important materials and minerals in the Heap that could be salvaged, or 
recycled.
       "Black Aracnia. Stop dawdiling and begin a search. I believe it must 
be here, somewere. The north zone is the most dense and we should try there 
first." He fianally made eye contact with the widow. She glared back at him 
sternly.
    Subcommander Putnam emerged from the out cropping of a large metal slab. 
In his hand he held an energon pistol, aimed at Hell Beast. His blue eyes 
were lcoked on him, intensely.
       "Predacons, what do we owe the pleasure of this visit?" He said in a 
cold voice. His silver body looked out of place in the Heap. They stood in 
dirty filth, but Putnam still remaind a sparkling silver in the moonlight.
       Hell Beast turned to see that Ominous, Quasar, Akron, Odiphious, and 
Venus all were positioned above them, each so they were surrounded and with 
weapons pointed at the two Predacons.
       "Ominous Prime! I should have suspected such treachery from an 
energonian." Hell Beast said. His computer now lay in the soft earth.
       Ominous made his way down to the level of his long time nemisis. The 
creation was now eye and eye with the creator. Bittness showed in there 
faces. The hate was strong between them.
       "Hell Beast, let me join you." He said finally, and the Predacon duo 
both dropped jaws and stared at the same creations that vowed to destroy the 
transformer race.

--part1_4f.9c8b72f.27fccbff_boundary
